newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian police investigating ASC break-in.
newsitem.headline: Australian police investigating ASC break-in.

text.p: Police are looking into a reported break-in at Australian Securities Commission offices which a newspaper on Tuesday linked to an ongoing investigation into dealings in shares of retailing giant Coles Myer Ltd.

"The Australian Federal Police can confirm that we are undertaking initial inquiries into a reported incident at the offices of the Australian Securities Commission," police spokesman Keith Livingston told Reuters.
"As those inquiries are ongoing it would be inappropriate to make any further comment," he said.

Melbourne's Herald Sun newspaper reported on Tuesday that intruders broke into the ASC's Melbourne offices over the weekend to "spy" on documents relating to Coles Myer, Australia's largest retailing group.
"They ignored money, valuables and unlocked doors and made for the 'Coles Myer room'," the newspaper said.

The locked room contained sensitive documents concerning the so-called Yannon transaction, a 1990 deal which cost Coles Myer A$18 million (US$13.9 million) and benefitted a company associated with former chairman Solomon Lew by a similar amount.
The break-in was discovered by staff on Monday morning, the newspaper said. The ASC said it had no immediate comment.
